summary: This is an FBI administrative request for $50,000 in 'show money' to be used in an undercover operation targeting Alfredo Rodriguez. Rodriguez, who was previously interviewed by the FBI in 2007, is refusing to comply with a federal subpoena for documents related to a child sex solicitation case unless he is paid $50,000. The plan is to have an undercover agent meet with Rodriguez, show the money, obtain the documents, and then arrest him for obstruction of justice.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.role: Target of investigation, individual in possession of subpoenaed documents
persons.context: He was served with a federal subpoena for documents related to a child sex solicitation investigation but refuses to turn them over unless paid $50,000. He was previously interviewed by the FBI in 2007 about the same information.

persons.name: Brad Edwards
persons.context: He reported to agents that Alfredo Rodriguez was served with a subpoena and is demanding $50,000 for the documents.

persons.name: SSA
persons.context: Had a telephone call on 10/28/2009 regarding the 'show money' request for this case.

persons.name: AUSA §§§
persons.context: Met with agents and attorney Brad Edwards regarding Alfredo Rodriguez's refusal to comply with the subpoena.

connections.description: Rodriguez was served with a federal subpoena for documents and is demanding $50,000 from attorney Brad Edwards to produce them.
The AUSA's office believes Rodriguez may have lied to investigators and that he possessed the subpoenaed documents during his 2007 interview.
Edwards met with agents and the AUSA to report on Alfredo Rodriguez's refusal to comply with the subpoena.

events.title: FBI Interview of Alfredo Rodriguez
events.description: Alfredo Rodriguez was interviewed by the FBI regarding information he is now trying to sell. The USA's Office believes he may have lied and possessed the relevant documents at that time.

events.title: Meeting with AUSA and Attorney
events.description: Agents met with an AUSA and attorney Brad Edwards, who reported Rodriguez's demand for $50,000 in exchange for subpoenaed documents.

events.title: Request for 'Show Money'
events.description: The FBI's Miami squad formally requested $50,000 in 'show money' to be wired for an undercover operation to obtain documents from and arrest Alfredo Rodriguez.

events.title: Planned Undercover Operation and Arrest
events.description: The FBI plans to introduce an undercover agent (UCE) to Rodriguez, use the show money to obtain the documents he possesses, and then arrest him for Obstruction of Justice.

keyFacts: Alfredo Rodriguez, previously interviewed by the FBI in 2007, is demanding $50,000 from attorney Brad Edwards to produce documents subpoenaed in a federal child sex solicitation investigation.
The U.S. Attorney's Office believes Rodriguez may have lied to investigators in 2007 and that the documents were in his possession at that time.

The FBI is requesting $50,000 in 'show money' to conduct an undercover operation where an agent will meet Rodriguez, show the money, obtain the documents, and then arrest him for Obstruction of Justice.

The documents are described as potentially containing evidence against an individual suspected of soliciting minors for sex, directly linking this obstruction case to the broader Epstein investigation.
The document is an internal FBI administrative request (a 'lead') to finance and criminal investigative divisions to authorize and process the wire transfer for the undercover funds.
